description.narrative: Increase Access to Finance for SMEs and Women-owned SMEs: The Project will offer alternative sources of financing to SMEs, especially small companies, which are not be able to get access to adequate funding from local financial institutions. The Brazilian SMEs represent a very broad market segment consisting of millions of companies that have limited access to conventional credit facilities through the Brazilian financial system. This is the case, particularly, in markets outside Brazil's main cities, which are underserved by financial institutions. Given the recent recession and still uncertain economic scenario, SMEs are facing a particular difficult moment to access credit in Brazil. Additionally, by offering an alternative source of financing to SMEs, the Project will also reach an underserved segment, which is Women-owned SMEs. Financing for on-lending through digital channel: The Project will support an innovative way of offering financing to SMEs, by using technology. The use of a digital platform enables faster and more efficient processes, which goes in the opposite direction of traditional lending, creating competitiveness in the market. Furthermore, by supporting on-lending through a digital platform, the Project will enhance financial connectivity and inclusion. In a large country like Brazil, offering a product, which is accessible in any geographic location will scale financing to SMEs and lead to market integration.
